Organisation Purpose Amount USD Country Programme Sub Programme Year Awarded Duration
Women at the Table To increase the participation, leadership and influence of frontline/grassroots women leaders on issues that impact women and their communities. This will be done by: strengthening their communication skills; making their knowledge and expertise visible; enabling them to bring their messages to a wider audience; and building a movement of senior decision makers globally that work to implement their recommendations. 300'000.00 Switzerland Issues Affecting Women 2017 35 months (01 Jul 2017-30 Jun 2020)
Women Deliver To provide core support to Women Deliver, a global advocate for gender equality and the health, rights and wellbeing of girls and women. Women Deliver brings together diverse voices to drive progress for all, including on maternal, sexual and reproductive health and rights. Women Deliver builds capacity, shares solutions and forges partnerships to create coalitions and catalyse actions that spark political commitment and investment in girls and women. 400'000.00 Worldwide Issues Affecting Women 2018 23 months (1 Aug 2018-31 Jul 2020)
Women in Dialogue (for Women Against Rape - WAR) To provide core support to WAR, enabling it to empower victims to be better informed, stronger and more confident advocates. WAR also works to improve access to justice for survivors of rape and domestic violence and supports women who have fled to the UK to escape rape or domestic violence. 240'000.00 United Kingdom Issues Affecting Women 2016 36 months (1 Aug 2016-31.07.2019)
Women Win To support Win-Win Strategies to connect the power of business with women’s funds and organisations to economically empower women globally. Win-Win Strategies works with and for women’s funds, women’s local organisations and companies to create meaningful partnerships and practical business initiatives for women. 450'000.00 Worldwide Issues Affecting Women 2018 35 months (1 Oct 2018-30 Sep 2021)
Women's Aid To provide support to domestic abuse services in the United Kingdom so that they become more sustainable and their organisational and financial stability are increased. Women's Aid Federation of England is a UK-based organisation which supports women and children who have suffered from, or are exposed to, gender-based violence. 627'245.00 United Kingdom Housing and Homelessness Homelessness prevention 2017 35 months (01 Nov 2017-31 Oct 2020)
Women's Fund in Georgia To provide core support to WFG, enabling it to advance its mission of empowering women and the women's movement in Georgia. This will be done by providing financial and technical support, capacity building and developing feminist philanthropy. The grant will also contribute to the organisational development of WFG, a local grant-making organisation that supports women's groups, activities and initiatives for social change in Georgia. 225'000.00 Georgia Issues Affecting Women 2017 35 months (01 Jul 2017-30 Jun 2020)
Women's International League for Peace and Freedom (WILPF) To provide core support to WILPF to strengthen the capacity of frontline women's organisations to mobilise for peace, equality, justice and human security. In doing so, women's organisations will influence laws and policies to better protect women and their communities from violent conflict. WILPF is an international not-for-profit anti-war organisation that brings women together to oppose conflict, violence and global militarisation. 1'475'000.00 Switzerland Issues Affecting Women 2017 35 months (01 Jul 2017-30 Jun 2020)
Women's Law Center To provide core support to WLC to continue its work to ensure the protection of women's rights and help reduce violence against women in Moldova. WLC supports a human-rights based approach and strives for change at individual, community and systemic levels. It focuses on: policy advocacy, monitoring implementation of new laws and protection mechanisms; and providing legal services to women and children affected by domestic violence. 300'000.00 Moldova Issues Affecting Women 2016 36 months (1 Aug 2016-31.07.2019)
Women's Link Worldwide To provide core support to continue using the power of law to promote social change that advances the human rights of women and girls. Women’s Link takes the law beyond the courtroom by: strengthening the human rights infrastructure; shaping public debates; and contributing to social movements that transform society and guarantee women’s and girls rights. Women’s Link uses legal, communications and mobilisation strategies to work across three themes: reproductive rights, violence and discrimination. 390'000.00 Worldwide Issues Affecting Women 2018 35 months (1 Apr 2018-31 Mar 2021)
Women's Refugee Commission To ensure that every migrant in the US, particularly women, children and families, have full access to legal protection and safety as provided by the Refugee Convention and international human rights standards. WRC's Migrant Rights and Justice Program monitors immigration detention facilities' conditions, undertakes advocacy based on policy and legal reviews and research into Alternatives to Detention, and provides technical assistance to federal agencies and community organisations. 500'000.00 Worldwide International Human Rights Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture 2016 36 months (1 Oct 2016-01.10.2019)
Women's Refugee Commission To improve the prevention and response efforts of humanitarian actors working to reduce sexual violence against boys and men, including gay, bisexual, and transgendered persons. The aim is to help reduce sexual violence in crisis-affected communities, including against women and girls. 382'590.00 Worldwide Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Solutions and advancing action 2018 35 months (1 Jun 2018-31 May 2021)
WonderWork To support local implementing partners in Zimbabwe to provide 4500 cataract and 300 burn reconstructive surgeries to adults and children across the country over a three year period. 450'000.00 Zimbabwe Special Interest 2016 36 months (1 Jul 2016-30.06.2019)
Working Chance To provide core support to Working Chance to expand its service delivery into the North of England and to develop its care leavers service. Working Chance is the UK's only specialist recruitment consultancy for women with criminal convictions and women care leavers. It supports women into employment placements and develops relationships with potential employers, including larger private sector corporate partners. 1'000'000.00 United Kingdom Housing and Homelessness Economic self-sufficiency 2017 47 months (01 Feb 2018-31 Jan 2022)
World Pulse To maintain and grow an online social network connecting women worldwide so they can create positive change in their communities and thrive. World Pulse harnesses the power of technology to unite women - both online and off - to be heard, to share resources, launch movements, start businesses, run for office, or courageously tell their story. 225'000.00 Worldwide Issues Affecting Women 2018 35 months (1 Oct 2018-30 Sep 2021)
World Resources Institute To strengthen WRIs global network by expanding the capacity and resilience of its international offices in Brazil, China and India. The World Resources Institute is a global research organisation that was established in1982. 2'800'661.00 Worldwide Environment Climate Change 2018 35 months (1 Jul 2018-30 Jun 2021)
World Wildlife Fund Canada Foundation To protect Arctic coastal and ocean ecosystems and the Indigenous peoples and wildlife that rely on them by empowering Indigenous rights holders. This will be done by: implementing a network of marine protected areas to protect critical habitats; developing regulations that constrain the cumulative impacts of shipping within sustainable limits; and establishing small-scale fishing opportunities that support sustainable livelihoods. 881'663.00 Worldwide Environment Marine 2018 35 months (1 Jul 2018-30 Jun 2021)
WWF International To support the establishment and operationalisation of the Global Climate Action Initiative, which promotes the implementation of the Paris Agreement and green development, especially in developing countries. WWF International works to tackle the drivers of environmental problems. 150'000.00 Worldwide Environment Climate Change 2018 11 months (1 Jul 2018-30 Jun 2019)
WWF International To ensure the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) will finance renewable energy projects exclusively in Vietnam, Myanmar and the Philippines. Promoting and accelerating a transition to renewables along the BRI, especially in Southeast Asian countries, will positively impact global efforts to combat climate change and will help create a clean, healthy and sustainable future for local people. 500'000.00 Worldwide Environment Climate Change 2018 35 months (1 Jul 2018-30 Jun 2021)
WWF International To assist and accelerate Chinas economic transition towards a low-carbon development path and to guide the â€˜One Belt, One Road Initiative in a green and sustainable direction. The aim of the â€˜One Belt, One Road Initiative is to promote the orderly and free flow of economic factors by enhancing the connectivity of Asia, Europe and Africa. This project will help China and the â€˜One Belt, One Road countries achieve their climate change commitments. The project also seeks to facilitate the phasing-out of ivory trade in China. 695'772.00 Switzerland Environment Climate Change 2017 35 months (01 Jul 2017-30 Jun 2020)
WWF International To address the challenge of global fisheries sustainability by increasing collaborative actions in China. WWF has registered a fundraising entity in China that will help build an industrial fishing portfolio in China in the coming years. 136'558.00 China Environment Marine 2018 11 months (1 Apr 2018-31 Mar 2019)
WWF International To eliminate illegal fishing in the Korean fishing industry and instead promote transparent, sustainable fisheries. This will be done by: engaging with Korean fishing and tuna industry actors in discussions; providing awareness-building opportunities to distant water fleet owners; and working with distant water fleet owners to encourage voluntary transparency/traceability practices. 150'000.00 Worldwide Environment Marine 2018 23 months (1 Jan 2019-31 Dec 2020)
WWF International To provide young people with an opportunity to engage in the conservation of the environment through internship programmes in WWF's offices around the world and to develop the world's future leaders in sustainable development. WWF works to conserve nature and reduce the most pressing threats to the diversity of life on Earth. 396'040.00 Switzerland Special Interest 2017 36 months (01 Jul 2017-01 Jul 2020)
x:talk To provide core support to x:talk to enable it to continue mobilising and empowering sex workers in the UK and globally to improve their working lives. This grant will also support sex workers to challenge the laws and stigma that place them at risk of violence and exploitation. X:talk is a grassroots sex worker-led cooperative that provides peer support services to migrant sex workers. It is active in the struggle for sex workers and migrant workers in the UK and globally. 296'000.00 United Kingdom Issues Affecting Women 2018 59 months (1 Jun 2018-31 May 2023)
YouthBuild USA To adapt the YouthBuild schools diploma granting model to Mexico, Brazil and South Africa, where pathways to secondary education credentials for early high-school leavers are currently not available. This school model will be responsive to diverse learning needs. It will provide experiential learning environments and opportunities to build leadership among a global network of youth across multiple countries, who have a shared experience of disconnection, dislocation and marginalisation. 600'670.00 Worldwide Learning Differences 2018 22 months (15 Jul 2018-15 May 2020)
Zacchaeus 2000 Trust To provide core support to Z2K to develop its services in London. Z2K seeks to support people on low incomes who face debt due to housing and household expenditure or who are in dispute with the welfare benefit system. It also lobbies for improvements to the legal and benefits system in the UK and provides training to volunteers and community groups on issues of debt management and welfare reform. 757'440.00 United Kingdom Housing and Homelessness Homelessness prevention 2014 59 months (1 Oct 2014-30.09.2019)
Zimcare Trust To provide core support to Zimcare Trust. Zimcare works to facilitate an enabling environment for learning and care programmes that are anchored in individual needs and designed to help each person to excel. 335'509.00 Zimbabwe Zimbabwe Special Needs Education 2018 11 months (1 Apr 2018-31 Mar 2019)
Zoological Society of London To create a “refill revolution" across the city of London by 2021, which will reduce the number of single-use plastic water bottles entering the ocean. This will be done by creating a culture in the city where using and refilling are fillable water bottle is accepted as the social norm. 609'240.00 United Kingdom Environment Marine 2018 36 months (1 Mar 2018-1 Mar 2021)
Zoological Society of London, The To realise the potential for growth of both black rhino and elephant populations in the Tsavo Conservation Area in Kenya. This will be done by: developing the rhino programme together with Kenyan Wildlife Services (KWS); securing Tsavos elephant population by providing intelligence on threats; and providing anti-poaching support to KWS by developing rapid-response teams and improved proactive law enforcement in target areas. 931'290.00 Kenya Environment Wildlife Conservation and Trade 2016 58 months (1 Dec 2016-30.09.2021)
